page.title: 02SOCIAL CONCERNS.
page.content:
Residential Methodist Youth Centre.
This residential centre in square four of our block was opened in September 1968 by Mr. Paul Bartlett Lang in the building which used to be the Primary School in the village of Chisworth. The school had been closed for some years. It was converted with a grant from the Joseph Rank Trust. The Youth Centre sleeps 26 and takes any age of children. They cater for themselves in a large kitchen with several cookers. The children come from many parts of the North for a country holiday and for hiking etc. They sleep in dormitories and there is a large lounge for the evenings.
